abstractText: A fundamental and very popular sūtra on various topics of mahāyāna Buddhism (philosophy, medicine, legends, dhāraṇīs etc.), dating to no later than the early 5th century CE. In Nepal it is considered to be one of the nine dharmas. According to the colophon, this manuscript was written in the late 18th century in Kathmandu during the reign of Raṇa Bahādur Shah (1775–1805), and commissioned by a certain Dhālasika as an object of worship.
